      • speedTimesTime

        public static DoubleScalar.Rel<LengthUnit> speedTimesTime(DoubleScalar.Rel<SpeedUnit> speed,
                                          DoubleScalar.Rel<TimeUnit> time)
        Distance is speed times time.
        s(t) = v * t
        Parameters:
        speed - DoubleScalar.Rel<SpeedUnit>; the speed
        time - DoubleScalar.Rel<TimeUnit>; the time
        Returns:
        DoubleScalar.Rel<LengthUnit>; the resulting distance

      • accelerationTimesTimeSquaredDiv2

        public static DoubleScalar.Rel<LengthUnit> accelerationTimesTimeSquaredDiv2(DoubleScalar.Abs<AccelerationUnit> acceleration,
                                                            DoubleScalar.Rel<TimeUnit> time)
        Distance is 0.5 times acceleration times time squared.
        s(t) = 0.5 * a * t * t
        Parameters:
        acceleration - DoubleScalar.Rel<AccelerationUnit>; the acceleration
        time - DoubleScalar.Abs<TimeUnit>; the time
        Returns:
        DoubleScalar.Rel<LengthUnit>; the resulting distance

      • accelerationTimesTime

        public static DoubleScalar.Rel<SpeedUnit> accelerationTimesTime(DoubleScalar.Abs<AccelerationUnit> acceleration,
                                                DoubleScalar.Rel<TimeUnit> time)
        Speed is acceleration times time.
        v(t) = a * t
        Parameters:
        acceleration - DoubleScalar.Rel<AccelerationUnit>; the acceleration
        time - DoubleScalar.Rel<TimeUnit>; the time
        Returns:
        DoubleScalar.Rel<SpeedUnit>; the resulting speed

      • speedDividedByAcceleration

        public static DoubleScalar.Rel<TimeUnit> speedDividedByAcceleration(DoubleScalar.Rel<SpeedUnit> speed,
                                                    DoubleScalar.Rel<AccelerationUnit> acceleration)
        Time is speed divided by acceleration.
        t = v / a
        Parameters:
        speed - DoubleScalar.Rel<SpeedUnit>; the speed
        acceleration - DoubleScalar.Rel<AccelerationUnit>; the acceleration
        Returns:
        DoubleScalar.Rel<TimeUnit>; the time it takes to accelerate using the given acceleration from 0 to the indicated speed

      • deltaSpeedDividedByTime

        public static DoubleScalar.Abs<AccelerationUnit> deltaSpeedDividedByTime(DoubleScalar.Rel<SpeedUnit> speedDifference,
                                                         DoubleScalar.Rel<TimeUnit> timeDifference)
        Acceleration is speed difference divided by time difference.
        a = dv / dt
        Parameters:
        speedDifference - DoubleScalar.Rel<SpeedUnit>; the speed difference
        timeDifference - DoubleScalar.Rel<TimeUnit>; the time difference
        Returns:
        DoubleScalar.Abs<AccelerationUnit>; the average acceleration needed to match the given inputs
